title: Magnetic field at center of growing loop

content.question: The single, circular wire loop of radius R shown above carries a current I that produces a magnetic field B at the center of the loop. If the current remains constant while the loop is enlarged to a radius of 2R, what happens to the magnetic field at the center?

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
